attributes.action: Scrap the property joint tenancy agreement to all non married couples
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The law currently states that if a person dies owning a property, that property will  be automatically passed on to the surviving person on the deeds if a Joint tenancy agreement exists. If the couple are married, then few could argue that this ruling is adequate. 
However, is it fair for the deceased persons blood relatives, such as children & parents, to see their loved ones share of a property, go to their surviving partner, particularly if they were estranged from one another prior to death or if they had only been co-habiting for a short time?
There fore make Joint tenancy agreements   unavailable to non married couples in favour of the fairer 'Tenants in common' ruling.
